name: Ghapama
description: A traditional festive dish involving a pumpkin stuffed with rice, dried fruits, nuts, and honey, then baked until the pumpkin is tender.
steps: Hollow out a medium-sized pumpkin, removing seeds and fibers.
In a bowl, mix cooked rice with chopped dried fruits (apricots, prunes, raisins), nuts (almonds, walnuts), and honey.
Fill the pumpkin with the rice mixture and place a lid cut from the top.
Bake in a preheated oven at 375°F (190°C) until the pumpkin is tender and the filling is heated through.
Serve hot, cutting the pumpkin into wedges to expose the sweet, fragrant stuffing.
tips: Choose a pumpkin that sits flat for easier baking.
Adjust the amount of dried fruits and nuts according to preference.
Ghapama can be served as a dessert or a main dish.
